Uses of Class
parallel.ParallelException

  • Packages that use ParallelException 
    Package Description
    analysis
    analysis package: a package implementing parallel algorithms for numerical differentiation and integration, and also including more complex transformations such as convolution.
    graph
    graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.
    graph.coarsening
    package defines abstract classes and implements algorithms for coarsening graphs.
    graph.packing
    Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 1- and 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.
    graph.partitioning
    Package defines interfaces and implements algorithms for graph and hyper-graph partitioning.
    parallel
    parallel package: an implementation of all the synchronization, communication & coordination primitives required in popt4jlib.
    parallel.distributed
    Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.
    popt4jlib
    popt4jlib: a parallel optimization library for Java.
    popt4jlib.GradientDescent
    Gradient-Descent Type Algorithms Parallel Implementation (suitable for real vector function optimization).
    popt4jlib.MSSC
    Package implements algorithms for Minimum-Sum-of-Square(-Errors)-Clustering, a well-defined optimization problem.
    popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning
    Package defines parallel/distributed versions of well-known Number Partitioning algorithms.
    tests
    tests package: defines functions used for testing the optimization algorithms in the popt4jlib library.
    utils
    utils package: containing useful classes and methods including I/O manipulation.

    • Uses of ParallelException in graph.coarsening

      Methods in graph.coarsening that throw ParallelException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void Coarsener.coarsen() 
      void CoarsenerIEC.coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the orinigal nodes: we visit an unvisited node randomly; we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course

      void DMsgIntf.execute(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      if the object is a DSendMsg calls the sendData() method on an appropriate parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator and once the data are safely sent, it sends back to the other end of the connecting socket an parallel.distributed.OKReply object, else if it's a DRecvMsg, calls the recvData() and once data are received, sends them to the other end of the socket.

      void DSendMsg.execute(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      sends the data and sends back to the JVM's thread that connected to the server, via the same socket an parallel.distributed.OKReply object.

      void DLock.releaseLock()
      release the lock across all JVMs asking for a lock for the particular pair that this lock is associated with.

      release the read-lock held by this thread.
      void DRWLock.releaseWriteAccess()
      release the read-lock held by this thread.

      runs the server.

      void PDBatchTaskExecutor.shutDown()

      Constructors in parallel.distributed that throw ParallelException 
      Constructor and Description
      DBarrier()
      no-arg constructor assumes the following defaults: host="localhost" port=7896 barrier/coord name = "DBarrierCoord_localhost_7896" The constructor will actually register the current thread with the barrier object of the server, so that later invocations of the barrier() method of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed DBarrier objects connected to the default server, default port, and default barrier name.
      DBarrier(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String coordname)
      constructor adds current thread to the barrier object of the server found in IP address specified by first two argument parameters with the name specified in the third parameter, so that later invocations of the barrier() method of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed DBarrier objects connected to the same server-port, and same barrier name.
      DRWLock()
      no-arg constructor assumes the following defaults: host="localhost" port=7897 rwlock/coord name = "DRWLock_localhost_7897"
      DRWLock(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String coordname)
      constructor specifies the IP address specified by first two argument parameters with the name specified in the third parameter, so that later invocations of the methods of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed RWLock objects connected to the same server-port, and same rwlock name.
      PDBatchTaskExecutor(int numthreads)
      private constructor, constructing a thread-pool of numthreads threads.
      PDBatchTaskExecutor(int numthreads, int bsize)
      private constructor, allowing to reduce the size of the batches submitted to the thread pool.

    • Uses of ParallelException in popt4jlib.GradientDescent

      Methods in popt4jlib.GradientDescent that throw ParallelException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double OneDStepQuantumOptimizer.argmin(FunctionIntf f, VectorIntf x0, java.util.Hashtable fparams, int varindex, double stepquantum, double lowerbound, double upperbound, int niterbnd, int multfactor, double ftol)
      computes a local minimum of the restriction of the function f in the j-th variable, under the box-constraints lowerbound <= x_j <= upperbound, and also under the constraint that x_j = x0_j + k*stepquantum where k is an integer quantity.
      private double OneDStepQuantumOptimizer.detdir(FunctionIntf f, java.util.Hashtable params, VectorIntf x, int j, double eps, double lb, double ub, double ftol)
      determine in which direction (up or down) the function f decreases, along the j-th variable, or return zero.
